Attorney General Eric Holder announces the indictment of five Chinese military members on cyber espionage charges .

WASHINGTON - The U.S. accused Chinese military officials of hacking into several U.S. enterprises to steal trade secrets and intellectual property in an indictment to be made public Monday , two senior federal law enforcement officials said .

WASHINGTON - The U.S. accused Chinese military officials of hacking into several U.S. enterprises to steal trade secrets and intellectual property in an indictment to be made public Monday , two senior federal law enforcement officials said .

WASHINGTON - The U.S. accused Chinese military officials of hacking into several U.S. enterprises to steal trade secrets and intellectual property in an indictment to be made public Monday , two senior federal law enforcement officials said .
It is the first time the U.S. has charged a state actor in a criminal cyber espionage case .

Federal law enforcement sources said the Chinese hackers , using military and intelligence resources , downloaded massive amounts of industrial information , including strategic plans , from U.S. businesses , including some located in western Pennsylvania .
